Based on your preferences, I would recommend two movies from this list:

1. The Passion of the Christ (2004))
This movie tells the final twelve hours in the life of Jesus of Nazareth, on the day of his crucifixion in Jerusalem.

2. Man on Fire (2008))
This movie tells the story of a man who has been living on the streets for several years and is forced to live on the streets as a way of survival for him.
The movie also tells the story of how this man becomes obsessed with finding a woman who he can use as a sexual object for him.
As a result of his obsession, this man begins to stalk women who he thinks could be used as sexual objects for him.
In one unexpected moment, this man finds himself face to face with the woman of his dreams.
Too bad she was completely out of his league.
Comedy and musical numbers ensue as their paths continue to cross.
It is said that there is NO GREATER gift than love, but can their love survive the test? Be careful. Things are not always the way they seem.

conversation.text: Based on the given preferences, I would recommend watching "The Yearling" (1930). The movie follows a young boy named Tom who persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer that is raised in the same small town as Tom's family. However, as time passes, the young deer misbehaves and causes Tom and his family significant distress and hardship. Ultimately, through perseverance, courage, and resilience, Tom learns valuable lessons about life, death, and what lies beyond the confines of human existence.
